verses.kjv: And the word of the LORD came unto me, saying,
verses.web: LORD’s word came to me, saying,
verses.ct: The word of the LORD came to me:

verses.kjv: Son of man, What is the vine tree more than any tree, or than a branch which is among the trees of the forest?
verses.web: “Son of man, what is the vine tree more than any tree, the vine-branch which is among the trees of the forest?
verses.ct: "Son of man, how is a grapevine better than any other tree in the forest? What makes its wood special compared to a branch from any other tree?

verses.kjv: Shall wood be taken thereof to do any work? or will men take a pin of it to hang any vessel thereon?
verses.web: Will wood be taken of it to make anything? Will men take a pin of it to hang any vessel on it?
verses.ct: Can you use its wood to build anything useful? Can you even carve a peg from it to hang something on?

verses.kjv: Behold, it is cast into the fire for fuel; the fire devoureth both the ends of it, and the midst of it is burned. Is it meet for any work?
verses.web: Behold, it is cast into the fire for fuel; the fire has devoured both its ends, and the middle of it is burned. Is it profitable for any work?
verses.ct: Look — it gets thrown into the fire as fuel. The flames consume both ends, and the middle is charred black. If it wasn't useful before, how could it be useful now?

verses.kjv: Behold, when it was whole, it was meet for no work: how much less shall it be meet yet for any work, when the fire hath devoured it, and it is burned?
verses.web: Behold, when it was whole, it was suitable for no work. How much less, when the fire has devoured it, and it has been burned, will it yet be suitable for any work?”
verses.ct: Even when the vine was whole, it was useless for building anything. How much more useless is it after the fire has eaten through it and left it burned?"

verses.kjv: Therefore thus saith the Lord GOD; As the vine tree among the trees of the forest, which I have given to the fire for fuel, so will I give the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
verses.web: Therefore the Lord LORD says: “As the vine tree among the trees of the forest, which I have given to the fire for fuel, so I will give the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
verses.ct: So the Lord GOD says: "Just as I've tossed the grapevine among the forest trees into the fire as fuel, that is exactly what I will do with the people of Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And I will set my face against them; they shall go out from one fire, and another fire shall devour them; and ye shall know that I am the LORD, when I set my face against them.
verses.web: I will set my face against them. They will go out from the fire, but the fire will devour them. Then you will know that I am LORD, when I set my face against them.
verses.ct: I will set my face against them. They may escape one fire, but another fire will consume them. When I turn against them, you will know that I am the LORD.

verses.kjv: And I will make the land desolate, because they have committed a trespass, saith the Lord GOD.
verses.web: I will make the land desolate, because they have committed a trespass,” says the Lord LORD.
verses.ct: I will turn the land into a wasteland because they have been unfaithful to me," declares the Lord GOD.
